website_summaries.verdict: Convenient features, quality construction, and economical price earn it the top spot for value on our shortlist.
pros: Boasts solid stainless steel construction from a trusted brand
Has an aluminum core and tapered rim for optimal performance
cons: Colander is relatively bulky compared to those of other models

customer_reviews.title: Got this pan and loved it. It heated very nicely and evenly
customer_reviews.text: Got this pan and loved it. It heated very nicely and evenly, did not stick or anything. Within a week it warped and the bottom is no longer flat; as such, it doesn't sit right on the stove burner and gets hot spots and half of it is a lot hotter than the other half. This has made cooking in it quite problematic. On top of that, it has developed a weird white spotty stain in it that's only visible when it's dry (see pictures). I have emailed Cuisinart's customer service over a week ago and have gotten no response at all.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Bottoms are NOT flat, Only the out edges touch glass top stoves!
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of these pans are NOT flat. They are concave and bow upwards. Only the outermost edges actually come in contact with glass top stoves. Returned immediately.
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: Excelent bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: I've never cooked on stainless before, much less a triple-layer clad skillet, and all I can say is "what in the hell have I been waiting for". My very first use I made pan seared boneless skinless chicken breasts that I saw on an episode of America's Test Kitchen called "Weeknight Workhorse's" season 11, episode 14. I did exactly what the chef says to do and WOW! perfection! Ide have to say the negative reviews that involves burning are most likely cases of trying to cook too hot and too fast. After a half dozen uses I am sold on the multi-clad idea. Only time will tell how the quality holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Bugsly

customer_reviews.title: Finally a good non-stick induction ready dual burner griddle
customer_reviews.text: FInally! I have been searching forever for a decent non-stick griddle that works well with a dual burner induction. This one fits the bit. Heat is also distributed so the whole pan heats pretty evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Saucepan
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a 4-quart pan from this line for a few years now. It quickly became my favorite pan. I finally bought the 3-quart—in fact, I bought two (one for me, one for my husband as his favorite pan recently broke—the handle came off). I love this pan, and the size is just right for the small amounts of food I often cook for myself. These pans heat well and retain heat well. They tend not to scorch or burn anything unless you really leave something unattended for a while or have the heat way too high. I definitely would (and want to) buy more from this set.
customer_reviews.author: reesah mouse

customer_reviews.title: Be aware of No customer service.
customer_reviews.text: We like the size. And feels solid as well. Only drawback is the inner layer gets rotted at the edge after some months use. We have contacted the customer service and no feedback at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tris P

customer_reviews.title: I'm pretty disappointed in this try
customer_reviews.text: I gotta say, I'm pretty disappointed in this try. I got it for X-Mas and specifically requested this one. There were cheaper ones, but I decided to go for a little more expensive one because I have always trusted Cuisinart. However, I have used this twice, and both times, left permanent burn marks on the surface during the searing process on the stove. Roasting trays are supposed to last a very, very long time, and at this rate, I don't see this lasting more than a couple years. Needless to say, the next roasting try wont be from Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a great price..UPDATE...PITTED AFTER 6 MONTHS USE.
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this pot. Beautiful construction, heat distribution, nice size. Cleans really easily, even crusty remnants come right off. Great price, great quality. I love the full clad aluminum, and it’s half the price of the more expensive All Clad cookware. UPDATE: 04/10/19. I’ve had this pot for about 6 months now, and I just noticed the bottom inside has pitted! Very disappointed, after paying over $50. I’d rather pay more for AllClad, knowing they will last forever. Down to 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Linda H.

customer_reviews.title: Stainless saucepan has worked out very well over the last two years.
customer_reviews.text: This is a review of the MCP193-18N 3qt Stainless Saucepan. After two years of use this saucepan is holding up very well. From the very start it felt very heavy and sturdily constructed and it's gotten plenty of use and still holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey H. Meeker

customer_reviews.title: does not heat well on induction
customer_reviews.text: I got this because it is supposed to work well on induction cooktops. I have a Thermador Freedom Induction Cooktop, and this griddle doesn't heat well and won't brown pancakes on it.
customer_reviews.author: ruthm

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with these pots. I have a set of advantage from Sears that have been used for about 15 to 20 years and they're still great, but they don't make them anymore apparently. They were made in America so that should tell you something. These pots seem to be just as sturdy and because they're taller rather than wider they are great for boiling things without having them spill over. I have not had any problems with staining and if you read the directions you can avoid that issue. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Material defect
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately after first use inside started pitting. Three pinhead-size pits appeared on bottom. Definitely defective material.
customer_reviews.author: Sirned

customer_reviews.title: Not a flat base
customer_reviews.text: After returning our original pan due to the bottom not being flat Amazon quickly sent out a replacement. Unfortunately the replacement has a warped base too and will have to be returned. I'm not sure if this is a defect or how the pan should be. I need a flat bottom roaster for gravies and deglazing. Since this has a warped base it causes pooling in the corners. Most people in the question and answers say it should be flat so I dont think it should warped. If it was flat then I'm sure it would be a good pan
customer_reviews.author: JessMcManus

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't good on Induction
customer_reviews.text: This didn't do well on our Induction cooktop. It was very uneven, and the heat level wasn't quickly changed with temp setting change. Didn't just not work well over the 1/2" gap but the entire space even the large burner. Really disappointed since the griddle was one of the things I looked forward to after not having a gas stove for so long. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Warped after first use.
customer_reviews.text: Pan warped during first use on medium heat. This is second pan because I returned the first one for the same reason. Not sure what the issue is here. I have the MCP set and they work fine with no issues. Really wish this pan would not warp so I can have a matching set but looks like I'll have to find a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pan for the price. I used it on both an induction cooktop as well as coil electric and it works great on both. The only thing to note is that it scratches easily if you use metal utensils, which is normal and does not affect the performance. If you want it to not scratch as much or as fast, use wood or plastic utensils only. Mine did scratch the first time I used it but I bought it to use, not to display so I'm fine with it. Why spend like 3x as much on an All-Clad when this performs like 90% as well?
customer_reviews.author: Mediahound 🎧

customer_reviews.title: Nice, sturdy construction with even heating
customer_reviews.text: Nice, sturdy construction with even heating. The handle stays cool as advertised. I can confirm that it works well with induction cooktops. It's a good saucepan and I expect it to serve me well for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse pans!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for everything from cooking beans or rice to making large batches of tea from herbs. You need to get non metal spoons so you don't scratch them, and cleaning them can be a little problematic, but they're a step up from the cheap pans that I used to buy The Big Box store.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth B. Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: The only griddle you’ll need for induction stoves
customer_reviews.text: This is a great griddle for slide in induction ranges. We recently purchased a GE Café induction range and it has a bit of a vent lip and a elevated control panels where I was worried this griddle would rub against, totally not an issue. Plenty of room and plenty of cooking surface The Tri-Ply metal clad used in this griddle effectively distributes heat (see my video video measuring surface temp). My only con is it doesn’t sit absolutely flat (very slight warp). It hasn’t impacted performance and hasn’t caused any induction detection issues as of yet on our specific stove. Great griddle!
customer_reviews.author: P120D1GY

customer_reviews.title: Learning How to Cook Again
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as replacement for a smaller, bottom-clad Cuisinart pan that got heat-damaged due to inattention. I like this new pan, but as usual, a new pan requires new lessons on cooking. Specifically, I find this requires slightly higher heat, more water, and longer period to cook red potatoes to make mashed potatoes. It's just a new learning curve. Otherwise I'm quite satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: hulithedane

customer_reviews.title: Short handles are better
customer_reviews.text: This is the same pan as the 5.5 qt. sauté pan, but with two helper handles instead of one long handle and one helper handle. This fits in my pantry and on my stove much better, and has the same functionality. And it cleans up beautifully, since it can sit flat in my sink for a short soak (the long handled pan would have to sit on the counter for a soak).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sticks a lot even with oil and not stainless at all !
customer_reviews.text: It's pricy and the product description says it's stainless but in reality, it sticks a lot even with oil when I tried to fry something. It also sticks a lot and I have to scrape with metal sponge, which is why I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: Uneven heat distribution
customer_reviews.text: Today was my First use on a brand new induction stove. I am so disappointed with the Terrible heat distribution! My pancakes were raw on the long side edges. I had to use only the middle of the griddle to make an evenly cooked pancake. Waste of Money!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan and Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Why pay more?
customer_reviews.text: My wife was dropping serious hints about an AllClad roasting pan. The AllClad is painfully expensive, so I turned up this Cuisinart in my research, and compared it with the Calphalon that was top-rated by a respectable cooking magazine. This unit has the tri-ply construction, like the AllClad, and the handles don't sit over the interior of the pan, which could be problematic as you are lifing a roast out of the oven. The bottom line is my wife is very happy with the pan, and it was reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Office Rat

customer_reviews.title: Came with marks
customer_reviews.text: Mine arrived today. Please see attached picture of markings that were present when I unpackaged the roaster.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B.

customer_reviews.title: horridly manufactured product
customer_reviews.text: cuisinart can't seem to make a roasting pan that's actually flat on the bottom. the first was so warped it was unusable and the replacement had a large gouge out of the inside of the pan and was also warped. obvious manufacturer defect. no option to replace the second time, not that i wanted to after the first two. refund only.
customer_reviews.author: h8grenade

customer_reviews.title: Does not distribute heat evenly (see photo)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my induction stove 1 1/2 years ago. I used it this morning & still get frustrated remembering that they advertised even heat distribution. You can see in my photo, only the area heats. Otherwise, we like it & it’s held up fine. Uneven heat distribution is a big fail for this expensive griddle.
customer_reviews.author: SharonB

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. I use it on an induction cooktop on ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I use it on an induction cooktop on the bridge. I've made all sorts of stuff from veggies to fajitas to burgers and it rocked them all. It seemed to heat pretty evenly even though it was across 2 elements, perhaps its the stove, perhaps it is this griddle. Only warning, it is pretty big so it may not fit in your dishwasher. I have to wedge mine in diagonally to fit it and I have a high-end GE unit.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Skinner

customer_reviews.title: Warranty Problems
customer_reviews.text: My pan lasted about 16 months and then the non-stick coating started peeling from the pan. The lifetime warranty on the pan is not what it appears to be because Cuisinart will not replace a plan where the coating is separating from the pan unless the pan is relatively new. Do not buy this pan for the lifetime warranty because you will pay to ship the pan to Cuisinart and then find out that the non-stick coating was compromised by customer misuse and you will be out the cost of shipping the pan to Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice for induction griddle zone
customer_reviews.text: Very nice design, was the only pan we could get to work adequately on our induction griddle burner. It’s a long rectangular element on a Samsung induction cooktop, round pans do not work very well on it, do not cook evenly, but this seems to work very well even though it’s a little bit larger than the heating element. The only thing I would change is to make the handles point out rather than up, because if you have it on an element that faces the handle forward towards you, the handle ends up getting in the way of working on your food.
customer_reviews.author: KatclimberTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: five stars
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to add my comment that this double boiler fits both my 2 quart pan and my 3 quart pan. Diameter of double boiler is 8.5 inches. My 2 quart pan is 7.5 inches diameter; 3 quart pan is 8.25 inches diameter. I hope this helps someone. I did not understand the dimensions listed under product details. I am happy that it fits my cookware and I am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BiLL

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy The Cheaper Cuisinart Of Same Size
customer_reviews.text: Bought the MultiClad Pro to replace a cheaper version of the same size and dimension Cuisinart pot that developed pitting corrosion all over the bottom and 1/3 up the sides in less than 2 years. The Multi-Clad is much heavier construction and would appear to be a higher grade of stainless steel. I use this pot often to cook small quantities of pasta because its smaller size allows me to use my mid size burner and the smaller quantity of water boils quicker - very nice here in the deep south. The quality of this pot appears similar to that of some high end french pots i own at about 1/3 the cost. Time will tell how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Wanderer

customer_reviews.title: Well made, heavy pot
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on a special deal. Waited quite a while for delivery, but was warned when I ordered that it would take nearly 6 weeks for delivery. I am overjoyed with this pan. Heating & cooking food is easy, but you have to learn to use a lower heat level as the pan heats quickly and holds heat. I have never burned food nor has any food stuck to the inside of the pan. The handle does stay cool as advertised as does the handle on the lid. I would buy this pot again in a minute. Looking for the comparable set at this time to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MLW

customer_reviews.title: It warps
customer_reviews.text: The pan was flat when it arrived. After 2 or 3 uses at low-medium heat, the bottom warped. Returned it for a replacement, and the same thing happened with the next one. At this point I can't return it, but I can at least tell others. This is the only pan I have that's done this, and it's also my most expensive pan.
customer_reviews.author: GAR

customer_reviews.title: the perfect pan
customer_reviews.text: i love these pans and have bought a few. the prices are a little high but I have to say, its heavy duty, and you will have it forever. I have had them a couple years now and they are still going strong, and the pans I turn to all the time, more often than not. the bottom can get a little cloudy depending on your water, and so I put a little bar keepers friend powder in the bottom and it comes right out. I have to do this with all my stainless sleet so thats nothing unusual..I don't think you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Irish AngelTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Beautifully made, smart design, looks great
customer_reviews.text: Feels and looks like Very high quality manufacturing that should last years and years. Looks great when we use it, and guests always ask what brand it is. The handles on the pan are easy to use (unlike my prior one where the handles flipped up and down - I burned myself several times messing with them. The handles on the roasting rack and great too. This isn't a cheap item - but it is one that I can confidently say is worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette H

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS POT!
customer_reviews.text: This isn’t a rinky-dink pot. It’s substantial and heavy duty. You can tell right away that the quality is amazing. The heat distribution is great and the clean up is so easy! I cooked chili in it and soaked it in the sink afterwards while I didn’t stuff around the house. When I went back to wash it, the chili residue literally glided out of the pot when I dumped the water out. Zero scrubbing and no oily residue was left behind. I just cleaned it when a sponge :) I’m off to buy more sizes!
customer_reviews.author: Sugar80

customer_reviews.title: How Do You Get the Stains Out?
customer_reviews.text: Even with a layer of peanut oil, the food sticks badly. I have tried different ways of removing burnt on stains including soaking with baking soda and vinegar, scrubbing with steel wool pads, scrubbing with the "Ringer" chainmail device and lots of elbow grease. None of the stains will come out. I have even ordered Wenol and when it arrived, I still could not get the stains out. I have only used this skillet a few times and I am throwing it out. I also have All Clad stainless steel pots and Revereware pots. I have never had this problem with them.
customer_reviews.author: Repeat Customer

customer_reviews.title: The edge is unnecessarily sharp
customer_reviews.text: I cut my finger when I was cleaning. The edge is not sharp like a blade but sharp enough to slice my skin off when I rub hard against tough burnt stains. After the cut, I soak the pan and wear gloves. But, what would be the benefit of sharp edged pan? Other than that, the pan is fantastic and does the job well.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Very similar to all-clad but much more affordable!
customer_reviews.text: I came here after watching America’s Test Kitchen reviews of saucepans. The All-Clad came in first but Cuisinart came in a close second. Both have similar designs but big difference in price. I’m happy I saved my money and bought the Cuisinart. The construction is tough. Nice and heavy saucepan with good heat distribution. Pours without dribbling. Lid fits on tight.
customer_reviews.author: T. Vu

customer_reviews.title: Great griddle
customer_reviews.text: I was worried this would work well with our Samsung induction. I was please to find it works great, The pan is heavy and a good quality, the non stick coating is high quality and doesn't seem to scratch. Eggs come right off and cleaning is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dumais

customer_reviews.title: Bottom warping after 2 uses???
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace a 20 year old Calphalon pan that had some warping on the bottom. Made it pretty hard to use on a glass top stove. This new pan looked to be exactly what we needed and it is a great size. Loved having he two handles rather than the long pan handle. But after only 2 uses I am already seeing warping on the bottom. Minor so far but if it gets worse I will not be a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: R. Adamo

customer_reviews.title: Great value Pots and pan once you learn the trick!!
customer_reviews.text: Great value stainless steel pot. To cook without sticking - thoroughly heat pan on Medium to med-low (to know if your pan is properly heated, if sprinkle a few drops of water in the pan - they should dance around the bottom until they evaporate). One heated, add oil... then cook. To clean, let soak and then use a plastic scraper if needed. If the pot gets a rainbow haze, use Barkeepers Friend with a sponge. Good as new.
customer_reviews.author: S Dougie Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Awsome pot
customer_reviews.text: The handle stays cool. It heats up quickly and evently. Cooks faster than my old conventional pots. Easy to clean. No issues staining. I find that cooking Gluten free pasta is now super easy, this design just works perfectly for that, saves time and it comes out perfect every time. I have used this pot and another one of a differnt size all the time and love them. Will be replacing other old pots and pans with this design in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Awsome pot
customer_reviews.text: The handle stays cool. It heats up quickly and evently. Cooks faster than my old conventional pots. Easy to clean. No issues staining. I find that cooking Gluten free pasta is now super easy, this design just works perfectly for that, saves time and it comes out perfect every time. I have used this pot and another one of a differnt size all the time and love them. Will be replacing other old pots and pans with this design in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome pan, but absolutely gigantic
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you know how big a 12 inch pan really is before taking this puppy home. This thing is huge, I really wish I'd have gotten the 10 inch instead, would be a lot more useful. Having said that, it's an awesome pan, heat distribution is spot on, nice thick bottom, doesn't warp or dip in the middle, and very high quality materials. Quality wise it's great, just really wish I knew how big it really was and could downsize a bit, might be good if you have a very spacious cook top and a family of 8 to cook for.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Diver

customer_reviews.title: It's the perfect size. Great price too for the quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for boiling eggs and cooking oatmeal. It's the perfect size. Great price too for the quality. I have Calphalon tri-ply cookwares but thought I'd give this a try because of the price. Didn't disappoint and in fact, I am very happy about this purchase. In the future if I need more tri-ply cookware, I will definitely search for this line from Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: Carol from Cali

customer_reviews.title: Warps
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2018 to complement a set of Duxtop that only had a 10" pan and I needed something a bit bigger. It was great for maybe a month but it's been warped and practically unusable since. I was reminded to write a review of this absolute trash because I just ordered an All-Clad 41126 to replace it. Heed all the reviews warning of warping. I didn't overheat or abuse this pan whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Electronic Addict

customer_reviews.title: It's Tri-Ply
customer_reviews.text: The one feature I prefer in a cookware is that it is not encapsulated (aluminum base bonded to the bottom of the pan) for reasons that it could come apart from the bottom (too much heat!) I believe a better design! Seems to cook as expected and am very pleased so far!
customer_reviews.author: Eddie d

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous pan, rack flawed.
customer_reviews.text: This pans a beauty. A veritable showpiece; especially for the price. I couldn't ask for more, really. For the sticklers - myself included - the stainless rack had a weld that looked like it had been clamped up in vise grips. Nothing that would affect usability but it's the kind of thing that while you were oohing and aahing over the fit and finish of it hitting a burr was kind of a buzzkill. Nothing that five minutes with a file, 800/2000 sandpaper and a little Mother's didn't fix. It's built to last. I have to ding it a star but I'd give it 4 1/2 stars if i could.
customer_reviews.author: Brian K

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this pan! Cleans up like a dream! Nice even cooking, great bottom clearance for roasting. I cannot believe, simply cannot believe how much nicer the food turns out (and how much easier the clean up is) then with my cheaper roasting pans. So far I've used it to make deep dish lasagna (I also boiled the noodles in it so they would not get crumpled), roast two chickens at a time, a turkey. To clean it, do as instructed, fill with water, put in dish soap (I use Dawn) and let soak (with the rack resting inside), it literally just wipes out. I wish I had purchased this years earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer Trading

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly for a Stainless Steel Frying Pan
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot to like for this 10" pan: 1. Looks great, 2. Nice weight distribution, 3. Good heat distribution, 4. Handle doesn't heat up, 5. Great size for a small meal or breakfast preparation, 6. Edges are good for pouring without mess if you have to, 7. If you burn it (I did, my fault) the BKF powder will make it new, and 8. It is reasonably priced. Small nitpick: I had an old 10" glass cover that doesn't fit perfectly, but it is usable however. This is well recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE the cool touch handles.
customer_reviews.text: I love these pans, So far I've only gotten 2 sauce pans but can't wait to add to the collection. The handles are very comfortable & cool to the touch even during cooking. I truely love that the handles don't get hot while cooking. The no drip pour edge is great too. Since there's no spout on the edge, It takes a bit of getting use to how to pour from the no drip edge though. While I haven't cooked anything complex in them as of yet, they seem to cook evenly.
customer_reviews.author: niteowl

customer_reviews.title: Currently one of my two favorite saucepans
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased th2 1,5 ct - and a 4 ct. saucepan from Cuisinart, 4 months ago, after watching "America's test kitchen." Both pots got a lot of use so far, and I am happy with every aspect of their performance. They are not as forgiving as non-stick when it comes to cleaning, but compensate in every other way. The handle feels good and secure in my hand. The saucepan can be placed in the oven. The lid slides over handle for easy storage. I am extremely happy with my purchase. At this time it looks as if this pot would serve me well for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Love this pan
customer_reviews.text: As someone that typically uses a non-stick pan or cast iron pan, I was looking for an everyday pan that is not non-stick. This works great! It heats evenly and does a good job. You will need to use some sort of oil or butter while cooking. The food may stick to it, but it does scrub off. It's just a little more work to clean, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: stacee evans

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and can be used on induction cooktop
customer_reviews.text: The middle section is not as hot as either end, and that could be due to our induction cooktop. Other than that, it is wonderful to use. We use it in weekends to cook bacons, eggs and pancakes. I also use it to cook 3 ribeye steaks at the same time. Clean up is also extremely easy. Because it is nonstick, clean up is very easy. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: stargazer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent conduction
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t had any problems with it. The heat conduction is excellent. I’m not cleaning it exactly as the instructions say, but don’t use anything scratchy to clean it. It cleans up perfectly well. The instructions say to put hot or warm water in it with soap right after using it. But this isn’t always convenient, so I’m not doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Humpleby

customer_reviews.title: Stury, easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: Hubby and I both love this pan. It replaced a 2.5 qt. pot that finally fell apart after 30 years daily use. The handles make it easy to lift and pour; its a perfect size for sauces, frying, etc. We've used it regularly for 3 months and the metal is holding up fine. It is a nice sturdy gauge metal and we're very happy with the pan.
customer_reviews.author: dottiesf

customer_reviews.title: Not even on heat.
customer_reviews.text: Still need to cook on it but my initial test was disappointing. You can obviously see in the video where the induction is occurring, it does not get within 2 inches on the edge no matter how long I wait. This means my pancakes are going to sad, and the effective cooking area is reduced in half. Can someone please make a decent griddle that works on an induction stove? Cast iron ones have that darn griddle on one side which makes induction spotty. I just want a slab of iron that distributes heat evenly!
customer_reviews.author: Adam S. Walter

customer_reviews.title: So far so amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Looks like money. The finish is, to me at least, exquisite. We use it daily for a morning cup of Indian masala tea. It seems to heat up faster than the old saucepan we used which is great as that probably saves us some power. I've washed it by hand and in the dishwasher and it looks spanking new still after 5 uses. Yes, it's just the beginning, but I am so pleased with it that I keep it visible in the kitchen. It looks that good to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great new, the bottom warped within 3 month of mild use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 12in skillet and it was great when I first received it. It looks high end and heats up extremely even and fast on radiant glass cooktop. I would totally give it a 5 star rating until the bottom warped within 3 month since I received it. I've used it probably once every 2 weeks, and i've always been careful to wait until the pan completely cooled after use to rinse it in lukewarm water. Always hand washed and never in the dishwasher. Today I noticed the bottom warped enough that the pan no longer sits flat on glass cooktop, and now only the middle of the ban gets even heating. I'm very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Lilyan

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I wanted in sauté pans. I did not want nonstick (you can’t sear with nonstick.) I was getting tired of the weight of my cast iron skillets, and these cusinart pans feel sturdy without the extra poundage. As for cleaning, pour hot water into the pan as soon as you are finished cooking. (Don’t use cold water - it might warp it.) After dinner, do a quick scrub with Bon Ami followed by soap, and your pan will shine.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: I love Cuisinart and I have been buying their pots and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love Cuisinart and I have been buying their pots and pans for years. This steamer is beautiful and solid, the stainless steel is of a very good quality. I really like that it can be placed on pots of different sizes. I recently used it on a fairly small pot, and it still steamed the vegetables perfectly. Buy Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: E. P.

customer_reviews.title: Good size Saucepan easy to clean, good value for money
customer_reviews.text: It was time to replace my old sauce pan. After some research I opted for this one. It is a tad on the heavy side, but still manageable even when nearly full. It has a smaller diameter and is deeper than the one it replaced, but it was not hard to adapt to the difference. The pan appears to heat very evenly on my gas range. Best of all, however, is that it comes clean easily. This wasn't the most expensive saucepan, but it is hard to believe that the more expensive ones could perform any better.
customer_reviews.author: K Lee

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend. Lid handle too hot to touch, and lid does not fit well.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: the pot has a good, solid construction. Heats well. Cons: The handle gets uncomfortably warm. What's worse, the handle on the lid gets so hot it can be touched only with a hot pad or a towel, which is really annying when I'm trying to cook. Also, the lid rattles constantly once the contents are boiling. If I prop up the lid a bit so that it doesn't rattle, it slides back down. I would definitely not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia

customer_reviews.title: Great Pro Quality Roaster - I scored at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a $130 Roaster I scored for $56 “used” which probably means someone returned it. It showed up in perfect condition and a day later was roasting a 20 lb Turkey. If I had my druthers I would have preferred the All-Clad version just bc we have a bunch of their pro quality cookware, but honestly this Cuisinart is a very close second and the price was perfect. It went from oven to stove to deglaze and start gravy - worked perfectly. The smooth surfaces made clean up easy. A great roaster.
customer_reviews.author: Moo

customer_reviews.title: This was the perfect addition to our other Cuisinart cook ware
customer_reviews.text: We cook every night. This was the perfect addition to our other Cuisinart cook ware. We already have the long-handled pan, same dimensions, so the short-handled one is a MUST. It gets used every night, washed, and placed on the cooktop, ready for the next day's meals. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: JoeB

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This stock pot is great. It is heavy and conducts heat well. I can cook food on lower temperatures which saves energy! I have used it several times and it is easy to clean and very sturdy and durable. I have another piece of cookware from this collection and both are very good quality. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Goss

customer_reviews.title: good heat dispersion, but wish lid was glass
customer_reviews.text: I'm upgrading to this from a set of cheap-o pots and pans, and I am happy. The water boils noticeably faster with this one. Only annoyance is the lid - since it is metal you can't see through. In the past I've used pots with glass lids, and I liked that better because you could see if it was about to boil over. Not a deal-breaker.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Great size, all stainless steel, but it does warp
customer_reviews.text: The size of the pan is great - perfect for making various dishes and very versatile. The fact that it is all stainless steel is also a big plus. Stainless steel is the only material safe enough to use for cooking. It does not have non-stick property like Teflon, but considering the health advantages, it is worth the extra time and effort needed to clean the pan after each use. Like other reviewers have mentioned, the pan does warp so it does not sit straight on a table/ stove top - seems to be a manufacturing issue. I decided to keep it because it is not easy to find all stainless steel pan in this size.
customer_reviews.author: Yevgeniy

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the pan and it seems very sturdy. The problem I have is that even when I just took a little bit of something that's not acidic or should leave spots or rings I have spots and rings in the brand new pan. I wash it and immediately dry it hoping that the spots won't reappear but they do. Not sure what the problem is.
customer_reviews.author: NanaJack

customer_reviews.title: Water stains hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: After the first use (boiling eggs) I put it in my dish washer and ran a gentle cycle. The water stains on the bottom and the walls would not wash off. I cleaned it multiple times already and the stains are still there. I feel like the stains are getting more and more as I use it more. I give it a 3 star because I like the size. It’s the right size for boiling eggs, heating up soup and making noodles for one person. It’s light weight so wouldn’t hurt your wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Peppa Unboxing

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful Multi-Clad Pro pot especially for large quantities of pasta
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Cuisinart over 40 years. I have all sizes now. This is a beautiful Multi-Clad Pro pot especially for large quantities of pasta. The core conducts the heat evenly and you can cook at a lower temperature. Easy to handle with 2 handles and has a beautiful shin that lasts for years. I recommend this product. It is equal to the All=Clad which are much more expensive. This is a terrific buy.
customer_reviews.author: Carmela Altieri

customer_reviews.title: Don’t - its not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this pan has been our go to favorite for breakfast pancakes, eggs, bacon, etc during the pandemic. We bought this in Apr 2020 and last week the nonstick coating has started to flake off the edges of the pan. BTW - this pan was $60 when we bought it in Apr and today (Aug 21) its now $83. At either price point, I expect more than 4 months of use... I have no idea what pan would be better without spending 2x or 3x the money, but this one is not the money. I cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: hard yakka

customer_reviews.title: Cooks as Good as it Looks!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product to add to the set that I had already purchased. It’s one of the best cookware products I’ve ever cooked with, and as with previous reviews of the full set, I can’t say enough how much I enjoy cooking with this cookware. It keeps heat evenly and long term similar to cast iron, but with a high polish that’s gorgeous as well as high quality performance that makes me feel like a Oro Chef! Never going back to Calphalon now that I’ve got my Cuisinart Multiclad Cookware!
customer_reviews.author: LeeLee Stramer

customer_reviews.title: Can't "handle" it!
customer_reviews.text: The pan itself is great. Thick metal, nice finish. The problem is the thin handle. It is too small for lifting, and wholly inadequate for turning to pour out contents. Truly, it is very difficult to "handle" this saucepan, because the handle is so poorly designed. That would seem a simple fix for Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: JAM of JC

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for Induction
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Cuisinart pan because we had an identically styled Cuisinart pan which could not be used on the induction cook top in our new house. This one works, but the bottom is not flat. That doesn't mean it cannot be used, but the heat distribution is not ideal and stirring the pan while on the stove can make the pan itself wobble and spin. We had to give up a whole set of Cuisinart pans when we moved. We do not plan to replace the others with the Cuisinart brand based on this experience.
customer_reviews.author: William Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Great size and weight.
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect pan. I bought this one and a smaller Tramontina.. I like the Cuisinart much better. The Tramontina in the same size as the Cuisinart was was almost $20.00 more expensive. I love the size and expecially the weight of this pan. I couldn't be happier with it. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little pot
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to find a small pot that can be used both on top of the stove and in the oven. I needed it to replace a very old Le Creuset enameled iron sauce pan with handle that is no longer made (the top doubled as a little frying pan.) The new Le Creusets were too big and heavy and also very expensive. This little saucepan works very well - it heats evenly and while I usually use it on top of the stove, it can also go into the oven because its handle is made of the same material.
customer_reviews.author: J. Biro

customer_reviews.title: i'm not doing temperamental cooking with this size saucepan - so I expect it should be just fine. it has a nice weight and seems well-balanced
customer_reviews.text: the measurements by the manufacturer are misleading (typical) - they are (not including lid) 6 1/4" inside below the rim. and 3 1/8" tall measured on the exterior. it holds exactly 1 1/2 quarts to the start of the rolled rim. I purchased this to replace a cheap anodized aluminum pan with a peeling non-stick coating. I have a bunch of all-clad d5 (which I adore) - and this seems to be as thick. i'm not doing temperamental cooking with this size saucepan - so I expect it should be just fine. it has a nice weight and seems well-balanced.
customer_reviews.author: K. Davey

customer_reviews.title: Distributes heat evenly including the sides
customer_reviews.text: I have four or five pieces of this line (I suppose that I should have purchased a set). They provide professional heavyweight performance. The only improvement would be a dome lid. I love to cook and I have tried about everything. I hate the non-stick stuff. Anodized aluminum works well. However, for all around performance and ease of cleaning nothing beats tri-core stainless steel. It's even-heating and nonreactive. I like Bar Keepers Friend for cleaning. Just know that the stuff does leave some fine scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Eyeconic

customer_reviews.title: Great value for someone who has the strength to hold it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good pot. It does not burn the food and the metal is thick. The only problem is, it is so heavy that I can’t use it. The cheap, thin-walled stainless steel Pots burn the food at High heat;and this does not, but it is so heavy that it’s almost useless.
customer_reviews.author: alda shelton

customer_reviews.title: One of my best purchases and my wife was a collector of Cuisinart ...
customer_reviews.text: One of my best purchases and my wife was a collector of Cuisinart pots and pans. So, when I needed a double-boiler to work with fine chocolate, I ordered a Cuisinart. It took very little time to learn how to use it, it fit perfectly in a large pot and the melted chocolate turned out perfect. It's also good for fine sauces and other things, which I'll be trying as well.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Good value for large sauce pan
customer_reviews.text: I needed a large induction and gas friendly sauce pan. This one was much less expensive than an equivalent All Clad. So far, it has been doing the job on many recipes on both a my induction burner, as well as gas cook top. I can see no reason to go to an All Clad version at triple the cost. Please however, don't translate my enthusiasm for this pot to other pots and pans in the CA multi-clad family. My review of the CA 12" sautee pan is more in the 3 star level.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: We remodeled our kitchen and put in an induction cook top. We really didn't know much about induction, but decided to try it. We bought this griddle to use instead of using our old electric griddle. Our cook top has a feature to sync two burners to use with such a griddle. We LOVE it! We cook pancakes, grilled cheese, eggs, tortillas.... on it with ease. It is so easy to clean. I would recommend this for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki H. Goble-Lane

customer_reviews.title: FABULOUS little pot- good looking, robust design, easy to clean, and functional!
customer_reviews.text: A Must-Own pot! I make individual servings of old-fashioned oatmeal every morning in this little guy, and it's a joy to use! Heat is well-distributed during cooking, and it washes up very easily and super shiny stainless steel! VERY happy with it, will buy more of these in different sizes. Lid works well and seals properly during cooking The weight and heft of both the pot and the lid are substantial, not cheap or flimsy-feeling! Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Robert MacIntel

customer_reviews.title: Best pan ever
customer_reviews.text: This pan is amazing, Non stick, solid, heavy duty, flat bottom. Just follow these care instructions and you will enjoy it for many years. Always use plastic or silicone utensils, Wash it with detergent and a soft cloth. Never use a scouring sponge. The only issue you will have is cleaning around the rivets. I use my figernail and it cleans right up. Oh 1 last thing, never run water over your hot pan. Set it to the side and let it cool before you was it. Best pan ever
customer_reviews.author: Edward Coleman

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed but it's a nice sturdy pan.
customer_reviews.text: This pan is very nice as pans go but I'm going to have to buy another to do what I really want. The heat is evenly distributed and does a wicked toasted cheese sandwich on relatively low heat. But when I tried to brown anything else, it stuck. In fact, everything but the toasted cheese sandwich stuck...badly. I cooked nothing above medium heat but if you like your crisp brown caramelization to stay firmly in the pan, this is the one for you. Perhaps I need to learn more about pans and how to season them, but at this point I'll be eating a lot of toasted cheese sandwiches from this pan.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Rose

customer_reviews.title: Solid Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Used for marinated meats, tofu, stir-fry, vegetables, and mostly eggs. Easy clean up with no discoloration after 2 months. It seems to cook the food evenly, I haven't noticed any hot spots. The handle remains very cool at high temperatures which was a bonus I wasn't expecting. Overall it's a great pan and I don't know what else you would want from this size or material!
customer_reviews.author: CWL

customer_reviews.title: Better than All-Clad!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this on my induction range and compare it to All-Clad. I put the same amount of water in each pan and timed how fast it would boil. This pan won. Not by much but the price difference makes it a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Does work on induction cooktops
customer_reviews.text: Actually works on a two burner induction cooktop. I've made pancakes that actually did heat evenly, The heat produced from the two burners spread enough to keep the majority of the pan hot. I did have to place the pan at an angle to get the most of each burner. Also nice that it works in my oven if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Materiel Grrl

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart MultiClad Pro pans are the BEST!
customer_reviews.text: Cuisinart's MultiClad Pro Stainless pans are the best on the market. They are at least the equal of All Clad and have better engineered handles and are about a third the price. For some reason or other, I thought this 10" fry pan was larger that my cast iron pan. It's the same size so I have returned it for a 12 in Calphalon TriPly Every Day pan with lid. The Cusinart model was an inch too long to fit into the drawer where my pans are stored. So, if you have a choice, choose the Cuisinart Multiclad Pro Stainless pans.
customer_reviews.author: C.M. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Warped at 400F
customer_reviews.text: Warped at 400F. I take great care of my pans. Always let them cool naturally, hand wash, etc. it'd have been an excellent pan if it werent for the warping. Unfortunately i have a glass top stove. Barf I think they nerfed the manufacturing. I have the older version of the multiclad pro and it is amazing. Im very disappointed with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Quality that Shines!
customer_reviews.text: Quality, quality, and quality. I ditched all my aluminum pots—so glad I did! This pot is heavy-duty, easy to clean, with a well-fitting lid, and the perfect size for cooking rice, veggies, soups, and much more. More than that, I don't have to worry about aluminum getting into my system. I hope I can keep it looking as beautiful in years to come as it is now. I hope to collect a mix of sizes of these.
customer_reviews.author: Ursula

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I Bought This Pan
customer_reviews.text: After buying other Cuisinart items and a larger stainless steel pan, I decided to buy this 8 inch pan. After a few days of sticking and ruining food, I hung up this pan and don't plan to use it again. It was pricey and had the Cuisinart name; but it has been a real dud! I don't recommend this pan unless you like food sticky and working your fingers to the bone cleaning the damn thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dan S. Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Um, just awesome
customer_reviews.text: Freakin LOVE this product line! As good as my all-clad. You can hammer in nails, fight off an intruder, use it to deflect grenade shrapnel and then cook eggs on it. Bought on a hunch, and totally happy. So happy I've basically replaced all my kitchenware to Cuisinart pots/pans. All-Clad can keep their over priced, elitist crap. I've got cuisinart
customer_reviews.author: Crist

customer_reviews.title: Solid Pot
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try this pot based on brand and beauty. I've used it quite a bit and have been very happy so far. The temperature seems to be even over the surface area of the pot, and for the most part cleans up fairly easily if I boil a little water in it. The only negative is the handles get quite hot after a short time, no discernable insulation for the handles. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Make the change
customer_reviews.text: I've been thinking about switching to stainless steel pots & pans because I'm so tired of my EXPENSIVE Caphalon non stick pots getting scratched up and ruined. I've noticed that so many of my existing pots are starting to keep the smell of whatever I cooked. I bought this one as a test before I jump in for a whole set and I'm NOT disappointed. I can't believe how easily it cleans and I love the way it cooks food. I've bought several more to build my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Rena Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Its a nice pan...value depends on use.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an everyday pan for cooking/frying eggs. Of course the pan will cook eggs but I quickly realized I did not like eggs sticking and the supposed "even" cooking seemed irrelevant when just frying up some eggs in the morning. The pan looked and felt very nice in terms of quality. I just didn't personally get or feel the value of the cost for just cooking eggs which was my primary usage. Back to a quality non-stick pan for me. Just can't beat it for eggs;)
customer_reviews.author: Carry

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid cookware
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a nice solid pot for boiling eggs and heating up soup, and this piece is perfect for those uses. The weight and design are very sturdy and it feels like it will last a long time. I have a pot in this size and a larger size saucepan, and I will probably add a covered saute pan in a few months. These pieces are replacing a set of cookware I bought five years ago that I have never really liked.
customer_reviews.author: shoebabe

product_meta.title: Cuisinart MultiClad Pro Stainless Steel 3-Quart Saucepan with Cover
product_meta.description:
Size:3 qt| Style Name:Stainless Saucepan with Cover

ENJOY THE FINE ART OF COOKING
Inspired by the great French kitchens, Cuisinart began making professional cookware almost 30 years ago. Constructed of the finest materials available to perfectly perform all of the classic cooking techniques, Cuisinart cookware continues a long tradition of excellence. Cuisinart's commitment to quality and innovation continues with the MultiClad Pro Stainless cookware, designed to meet the demands of gourmet chefs everywhere. Unique triple-ply construction joins a brushed stainless steel exterior, a pure aluminum core that provides even heat distribution, and a stainless steel interior, for optimal performance. MultiClad Pro Stainless lets you celebrate the fine art of cooking.

WHAT IS MULTICLAD PRO STAINLESS COOKWARE?
Premium cookware that features professional triple-ply construction, a core of pure aluminum bonded to a stainless steel interior and a brushed stainless exterior. Heat Surround technology maintains even heat distribution along the bottom and side walls of the cookware, eliminating hotspots. Premium stainless steel cooking surfaces do not react with food or alter natural flavors.

Updated Cool Grip handle design Tight-fitting stainless steel cover Tapered rim for drip-free pouring THE CUISINART DETAILS
Designed to provide professional gourmet cooking results, this cookware offers perfect heat and perfect results, every time.

The Choice of Professionals
Aluminum core heats and cools quickly for precise temperature control. Heat Surround technology provides even heat distribution along the bottom and up the side walls of the cookware. Stainless steel interior is ideal for delicately simmering sauces, perfectly sautéing vegetables, browning meats, or boiling several servings of pasta. 

Cover Seals in Nutrients
A tight-fitting stainless steel cover seals in food's natural juices and nutrients for healthier, more flavorful results. The cover is dishwasher-safe.

Drip-Free Pouring
The rim is tapered for drip-free pouring. 

Professional Results
Stainless steel cooking surface does not react with food or alter food flavors. Great for classic cooking techniques like sautéing, frying, browning, searing and slowly simmering sauces. 

Superior Heat
Triple-Ply construction includes the unsurpassed heat conductivity of a pure aluminum core. It insures maximum heat retention and even heat distribution, eliminating hot spots. 

Perfect Balance 
The exclusive Cool Grip handle stays cool on the stovetop. The handle's unique thumb rests are riveted for perfect balance and ultimate control when lifting and pouring.
feature_bullets: Updated cast-stainless-steel handle stays cool to the touch and comes riveted for strength
3-quart saucepan made of 18/10 stainless steel with solid aluminum core
Rims are tapered for drip-free pouring
Dishwasher-safe; oven-safe up to 550 degrees F; broiler-safe

Limited lifetime warranty Features: Professional Triple Ply Construction features a core of pure aluminum|Brushed stainless exterior|Heat SurroundTM Technology allows for even heat distribution along the bottom and sidewalls of the cookware|Cool GripTM Handle Solid stainless steel riveted handle stays cool on the stovetop|Drip-Free Pouring Rim|Tightfitting cover seals in moisture and nutrients for healthier more flavorful results every time you cook|Dishwasher Safe|Lifetime warranty|Suitable for use with induction cook tops

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,093 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
